text: Allen Glover Lanier (June 25, 1946 - August 14, 2013) was an original member of Blue Öyster Cult. He played keyboards and rhythm guitar. Lanier wrote several songs for Blue Öyster Cult albums. These included "True Confessions", "Tenderloin", "Searchin' for Celine", "In Thee", and "Lonely Teardrops". He also contributed to music by Patti Smith, Jim Carroll, The Dictators and The Clash. He dated Patti Smith for several years during the 1970s.Victor Bockris, Patti Smith: An Unauthorized Biography (New York: Simon & Schuster, 1999), pp. 77, 146 When Lanier started in 1967, the group was known as Soft White Underbelly. He left the group and was replaced in 1986 by Tommy Zvoncheck.Dafydd Rees; Luke Crampton, Rock Stars Encyclopedia (New York: DK Publishing, 1999), p. 111 He returned in 1987. He retired from performing with them after the autumn of 2006. On August 14, 2013 he died of complications from chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). == References == Category:1946 births Category:2013 deaths Category:American rock guitarists Category:Deaths from COPD Category:Musicians from New York (state)
